intro: Dimorphochlamys cabrae, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. Dimorphochlamys cabrae is adapted to harsh, sunny conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its natural habitat.
